title: Haaland Confirmed as Interior Secretary in First for Native American
summary: Along with energy leases on federal land, Haaland will oversee national parks, endangered-species protections, Bureau of Indian Affairs. WASHINGTON-The Senate confirmed Rep. Deb Haaland as President Biden's interior secretary Monday, in a vote that for the first time will make a Native American a White House cabinet secretary.

title: Oscars 2021: The Complete List of Nominees
summary: Here are the nominees for the 2021 Academy Awards, to be presented Sunday, April 25.. In a year when movie theaters were mostly shut down due to the coronavirus pandemic, a celebration of movies will go on. In the nominations for the 93rd Academy Awards announced Monday, Netflix 's 'Mank' led with 10 nods, and the streamer came out ahead with 35 nominations total. 'Nomadland' got a boost with nominations across key categories. Here, a complete list of nominees:

title: U.S. Is Setting Up Two New Shelters in Texas for Unaccompanied Minors
summary: Pace quickens of illegal border crossings by immigrant children, fueling political and humanitarian criticism. The Biden administration is opening new emergency shelters to handle the increasing number of young immigrants illegally crossing the border without their parents, people familiar with the plans said.

title: Powell Catches the Fiscal Bus
summary: Congress passed the spending he wanted. Now he has to finance it.. Jerome Powell lobbied publicly for months for more fiscal spending in the name of spurring the economy. Congratulations to the Federal Reserve Chairman, who has succeeded in catching the fiscal bus. Now his wish is Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen's command as the Fed has to finance the vast fiscal deficits to come.

title: Cuomo Should Not Resign, Say Half of New Yorkers in a Poll
summary: Democratic governor faces allegations of sexual harassment and criticism over handling of Covid-19 in nursing homes. ALBANY, N.Y.-Half of New Yorkers say Gov. Andrew Cuomo shouldn't resign from office, while 35% say he should, as he faces allegations of inappropriate behavior toward female aides and criticism over the state's handling of Covid-19 in nursing homes, according to a new poll.

title: Congressman Urges Safety Probe of Gov. Mario M. Cuomo Bridge
summary: Thruway Authority says a bolts issue at the Tappan Zee successor was resolved years ago. A Democratic member of Congress has joined calls for a federal probe into safety concerns regarding construction of the Gov. Mario M. Cuomo Bridge in New York.

title: The Spending Bill Cometh
summary: The free lunch is over as Treasury Secretary Yellen signals major tax increases ahead.. Democrats are elated with the popularity of their $1.9 trillion spending bill, which they passed under the political cover of the Covid emergency. Handing out money is always popular, especially when there appear to be no costs.

title: The Way Forward in Afghanistan
summary: Meeting Trump's May 1 withdrawal deadline could lead to a rout.. The Biden Administration is scrambling to find a responsible way out of Afghanistan by the May 1 deadline for the withdrawal of U.S. troops set by Donald Trump. Problem is, a prudent withdrawal on such a tight timeline is impossible.

title: A Different Center Holds in Germany
summary: A new center-left emerges as the old center-right sinks.. Germany on Sunday fired the starting pistol on this year's marathon of local and federal elections, with regional votes in two states. The results suggest voters are tiring of political stasis as Angela Merkel's 16-year run as chancellor nears its end.

title: I Won't Be Silenced by the Left
summary: They twisted what I said about Jan. 6 because they want Americans to forget last summer's violence and destruction.. I'm amazed but not surprised. Those who seek political advantage by dividing the nation hurl the worst possible accusations to silence anyone who challenges their left-wing agenda.

title: There's No Need to Panic About a Little Inflation
summary: A much bigger concern for the Fed is the real human misery caused by slack in the labor market.. Was that a posse of bond-market vigilantes galloping past my window the other night-shouting "inflation is coming" like a bunch of financial Paul Reveres? We haven't seen those guys since the 1990s. But it seems that bond traders are now rattled by the prospect of higher inflation. Should we ordinary, calmer folk be worried, too?

title: Eliminate the Bar Exam for Lawyers
summary: The disadvantaged pay the price for an elitist legal system.. The legal profession regulates itself-which explains how lawyers get away with practices that pad their own earnings and block nonlawyers from selling competing services at lower prices.

title: Why the U.S. Won't Leave the Indo-Pacific
summary: New challenges test American strategy, but the commitment is grounded in history.. The diplomatic tempo in the Indo-Pacific is picking up. On Friday the "Quad," an informal but increasingly formidable four-power grouping consisting of Japan, India, Australia and America, held its first (virtual) leaders' summit and issued a joint communiqué promising enhanced cooperation on issues ranging from vaccination diplomacy to climate change.

title: The 'Equity' of Bill de Blasio
summary: What's progressive about fighting public schools where racial minorities succeed?. Bill de Blasio has finally found happiness. Courtesy of Andrew Cuomo no less.

title: 'Red Line' Review: The Calculus Didn't Change
summary: U.S. diplomacy didn't stop Bashar al-Assad from murdering Syrians with chemical weapons. It only gave him cover.. Barack Obama's 2013 deal to destroy Syria's chemical weapons was touted at the time as proof that arms-control diplomacy can avert peril without resorting to force. The deal proved many things, but not that. It allowed Syrian President Bashar al-Assad to escape from the consequences of his own malfeasance. It also showed rogue states and terrorists how to survive, and Iran and Russia how to play America. The losers: Syria's people, America's credibility, and Middle Eastern peace and security.

title: News Corp and Facebook Reach News Agreement in Australia
summary: Sky News Australia also reaches deal with social-media giant. News Corp said Monday it has reached a deal to let Facebook Inc. feature news in Australia from some of the media company's key properties, including The Australian national newspaper.

title: Notable & Quotable: Harriet Tubman Space Telescope
summary: 'Not because Tubman might have made any contributions to astronomy, but because she . . . likely used the North Star to navigate to freedom.'. Physicist Lawrence M. Krauss writing in Quillette.com on March 14:

title: NFTs Are the Biggest Internet Craze. Do They Work for Sneakers?
summary: A recent $3.1 million sale of some NFT sneakers has speculators wondering about the future of digital fashion. Why the NBA's Top Shot clips and purchasable outfits in video games like Fortnite may hold some clues.. FEB. 27 MARKED the release of a trio of sneakers that looked a bit like doodled-on Air Force Ones-a collaboration between design studio Rtfkt and Fewocious, an 18-year-old digital artist living in Seattle. Listed respectively at $3,000, $5,000 and $10,000 the three chaotic designs, each slightly different, were sold during one seven-minute period. In total, 621 pairs were purchased, netting the equivalent of $3.1 million. In the current frenetic sneaker-collecting market, this rapid-fire exchange of money isn't as shocking as it sounds. (A single pair of Air Jordans sold at auction for $615,000 in August.) What's truly notable, however is that Rtfkt's shoes can't be worn. They can't even be touched or held. At least not yet.

title: Air Travel Is Showing Signs of Renewed Demand
summary: While CDC still advises against travel, bookings rise as airline executives voice optimism for demand rebound: 'This seems like it's real,' says Delta chief. Airline executives said they are starting to see a path out of the coronavirus pandemic as more passengers resume travel, following a weekend when airport volumes hit their highest levels in a year.

title: New York City Covid-19 Cases Stagnate
summary: Average rate of positive tests will be difficult to reduce amid new variants and pandemic fatigue, officials say. In New York City, the percentage of people testing positive for Covid-19 over an average of seven days has hovered between 6% and 7% for the past several weeks, a plateau that epidemiologists warn will be difficult to push down.

title: Biden Says Covid-19 Stimulus 'Already Doing What It Was Designed to Do'
summary: The president tapped former National Economic Council head Gene Sperling to lead the implementation of the plan. WASHINGTON-President Biden kicked off a promotional blitz for the $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief law Monday, tapping Gene Sperling to lead the implementation of the plan as he seeks to highlight the benefits for the public.

title: National Democrats Rally Behind California Governor Over Recall
summary: With recall looking likely to qualify for the ballot, Democrats including Elizabeth Warren, Bernie Sanders and Stacey Abrams announce support for Newsom. Prominent national Democrats have joined a new effort to fend off a possible recall of California Gov. Gavin Newsom that now appears to have enough signatures to qualify for the ballot this year.

title: Rogers, Shaw to Combine in $16 Billion Deal
summary: Canadian communications companies seek to invest in rollout of 5G wireless service. Rogers Communications Inc. agreed to buy Shaw Communications Inc. for about $16 billion, combining two of Canada's largest communications companies and setting up a regulatory battle over a deal aimed at speeding up the country's rollout of fifth-generation wireless service.

title: 'Still Woman Enough' by Loretta Lynn Review: A Legacy of Country Hits
summary: Reba McEntire, Carrie Underwood and others join the veteran singer on her 50th album, a mix of new tracks and familiar songs from her six-decade-long career..

title: U.S. Banks Will Turn Last Year's Fear Into This Year's Profits
summary: As the economy improves, banks are expected to pare back the cash stockpiles they built up to cover pandemic-era loan losses. U.S. banks are sitting on a pile of cash that could turn into billions of dollars of profits.

title: Two Men Charged in Assault on Officer Sicknick During Capitol Riot
summary: Officer who died after being injured in Jan. 6 Capitol riot was sprayed with chemical, court papers allege. Federal prosecutors have charged two men with assaulting Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick with a chemical during the Jan. 6 Capitol riot, according to a court document unsealed Monday, which didn't describe whether the alleged assault contributed to the officer's death.

title: Blackstone, Starwood Capital Team Up in $6 Billion Extended Stay Deal
summary: The two investment firms agreed to evenly split ownership of hotel operator. Blackstone Group Inc. and Starwood Capital Group have agreed to acquire hotel owner and operator Extended Stay America Inc. for $6 billion, a bet that a rare bright spot for the lodging industry during Covid-19 can shine brighter as the U.S. emerges from the pandemic.

title: Nashville Bomber Acted Alone, Driven by Paranoia, FBI Report Says
summary: Law-enforcement agencies find bombing wasn't an act of terrorism. The man who blew up a recreational vehicle in downtown Nashville, Tenn., on Christmas acted alone and the bombing wasn't an act of terrorism, according to a report by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and other law enforcement agencies.

title: Germany, France, Italy Suspend Use of AstraZeneca's Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: Countries join others in pausing shots after a small number of cases of blood clotting on the continent. Germany, Italy, France and Spain joined the ranks of European countries that have temporarily halted use of the Covid-19 shot made by AstraZeneca PLC over blood-clot concerns, dealing another blow to the continent's sluggish vaccination rollout and threatening the credibility of the vaccine itself.

title: Stocks Edge Higher Despite Declines in Energy Shares
summary: Dow, S&P 500 set new highs again. U.S. stocks posted closing records Monday, shaking off their losses from earlier in the session.

title: Third Stimulus Check: When Are the $1,400 Payments Coming and Who Is Eligible?
summary: Key details on income, dependent eligibility for new round of relief payments in newly enacted relief package. WASHINGTON-Another round of stimulus checks is heading to bank accounts now that President Biden has signed the coronavirus relief legislation into law, and money is starting to reach people this weekend.

title: U.S. Outreach to North Korea Goes Unanswered, White House Says
summary: Biden administration has sought a dialogue on Pyongyang's nuclear-weapons and ballistic-missile programs. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration has reached out to North Korea to launch a dialogue on Pyongyang's nuclear-weapons and ballistic-missile programs but has yet to receive a response, the White House said Monday.

title: When Does California Want a New Governor?
summary: As Gavin Newsom launches his anti-recall campaign, a new poll shows his approval rating at just 42%.. Amazing as it may seem in reliably liberal California, new polling suggests that even if Gov. Gavin Newsom (D., Calif.) can manage to survive a recall election, he probably won't be in office two years from now. A new Emerson College poll finds a virtual tossup in his approval rating among California voters, and a striking difference in voter attitudes between the Democrat who runs the state government and the Democrat who runs our national government.

title: $&@#%! (Tuesday Crossword, March 16)
They Got Covid One Year Ago. They're Still Sick.
summary: Scientists are putting new effort into understanding the troubling symptoms of long Covid. These patients are waiting for answers.. A year after the first wave of Covid-19 infections swept across the country, a group of patients is marking the start of an illness that never went away.

title: Texas Power Retailer Griddy Files for Bankruptcy
summary: State regulators shut down Griddy Energy's business after it sent hefty bills to customers after Texas's winter storm. Griddy Energy LLC filed for bankruptcy protection Monday with a plan to provide releases to former customers who were hit with hefty electricity bills during last month's extreme winter storm.

title: Nigerian Gunmen Kidnap Primary-School Teachers in Latest Abduction
summary: Surge in armed militancy has worsened security in northwest Nigeria, where kidnapping for ransom has become a lucrative industry. Gunmen kidnapped three teachers from a primary school in northwestern Nigeria on Monday, government officials said, as parents of students kidnapped in another school four days earlier staged a protest demanding the government bring their children home safely.

title: U.K. Plan to Toughen Protest Laws Sparks Worries Over Civil Liberties
summary: Opponents say the bill would lead to harsher penalties for pulling down a statue than for attacking a woman. LONDON-Days after the British police were criticized for breaking up a vigil held for a woman kidnapped and killed earlier this month, the U.K. government proposed legislation mandating prison sentences of up to 10 years for demonstrators causing "serious annoyance," prompting questions over whether the state is eroding civil liberties.

title: Smart Device Push Brings IT and R&D Teams Together
summary: Colgate-Palmolive and Procter & Gamble pair IT and R&D staffers to work on new products. Consumer-packaged goods companies, in a push to develop more connected devices, are deploying their information technology talent, experts in machine learning and app-building, to work alongside research and development groups to design and build new products.

title: Democrats' Appetite for Progressive Politics Gets Fresh Test in Ohio
summary: Resume Subscription. CLEVELAND-A crowded Democratic congressional primary in Ohio this year could provide an early test of whether voters want to embrace or challenge the party establishment as the Biden administration gets under way.

title: Brazil's Braskem Probes Bribery Claims in Mexico
summary: Petrochemical company has hired a law firm following allegations by former Pemex CEO. Braskem SA has opened an internal investigation into bribery allegations made last year by the former chief executive of Mexico's state-run oil company, according to a securities disclosure.

title: After Six Decades in the Same Family, a San Francisco Mansion Lists for $28 Million
summary: The 1800s-era Queen Anne-style home, which overlooks San Francisco Bay, was cut up and moved to its current location in the early 1900s. In San Francisco, a Queen Anne-style mansion that has been in the same family for more than six decades is coming on the market for $28 million.

title: The Pub the Pandemic Couldn't Kill
summary: McKeon's survived the lockdowns and restrictions. Many of New York's Irish bars weren't so lucky.. Yonkers, N.Y.

summary: It won't do to oppose them only when Democrats are passing costly legislation in times of crisis.. The intellectual disarray of the modern Republican Party was captured last week by Sen. Roger Wicker of Mississippi.

summary: In Pacific Heights, this mansion was built in the 1880s, and has been in the same family for over six decades.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Mortgage Rates Are Rising. Read This Before You Refinance.
summary: If you haven't refinanced yet, is it still worth it? Homeowners have a lot to consider before signing that application.. Mortgage rates are on the rise after nearly a year of record lows, providing a nudge to homeowners who want to refinance but didn't get around to it yet.

title: Chauvin Lawyer Seeks Trial Delay After Floyd Settlement
summary: Judge says jury selection will continue but he will consider delaying trial date due to $27 million settlement in Minneapolis. MINNEAPOLIS-The lawyer for the former officer charged with murder in the death of George Floyd asked the judge to delay the trial and consider a change of venue in the wake of a $27 million settlement by the city of Minneapolis with the family of Mr. Floyd.

title: Rating Ron DeSantis's Approach to Covid-19
summary: Before another pandemic occurs we need a national plan on how to handle it that includes broader costs and benefits.. Regarding Allysia Finley's "Vindication for Ron DeSantis" (op-ed, March 6): The data validates that California and New York relied on the wrong science to manage Covid. The science Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis relied on, provided by Stanford's Jay Bhattacharya, Harvard's Martin Kulldorff and Oxford's Carl Heneghan and Sunetra Gupta, proved to be the correct science.

title: Unions, Not Money, Keep Our Schools Closed
summary: Every student in this nation deserves the option of in-person learning. Is another $128 billion to schools, most of which won't be doled out until the 2022 school year and beyond, really the right answer?. Regarding Corey A. DeAngelis and Christos A. Makridis's "School Isn't Closed for Lack of Money" (op-ed, March 10): Thanks to Covid-19 and nationwide school closures, millions of students are missing from America's school systems. Kids are suffering, yet Democrats in Congress are letting liberal, hypocritical teachers unions run the show and prevent students from returning to the classroom.

title: HighPoint Resources Files for Bankruptcy Ahead of Proposed Merger With Bonanza Creek
summary: Heavy debt load and market pressures forced HighPoint to seek deal with rival oil-and-gas operator. HighPoint Resources Corp. filed for chapter 11 protection Sunday, hoping a fast pass through bankruptcy will help it seal a merger with another Colorado oil-and-gas operator, Bonanza Creek Energy Inc.

title: The Madness Machine Is Back to Help Fill Out Your NCAA Bracket
summary: Do you like teams that launch-and make-lots of 3-pointers? Or are you in the 'defense wins championships' camp? Choose your priorities and create a bracket.. March Madness is on the doorstep for the first time in over 700 days. The ongoing coronavirus pandemic hasn't canceled the Big Dance in 2021, but the long break between NCAA tournaments may have left you a little rusty in the art of filling out a bracket. (Click here to run The Wall Street Journal's Madness Machine.)

title: Warren's Wealth Tax Would Wreak Damage
summary: You aren't just taxing the very wealthy, you are affecting the entire U.S. economy.. Scott Hodges's "Warren's Tax Enriches Foreign Billionaires" (op-ed, March 9) may not worry the vast majority of U.S. citizens who may not care which billionaires win, but there is more to the story. When U.S. billionaires pay wealth taxes, they will likely reach for the most liquid assets-stocks. Not only will investments in U.S. companies diminish, and thereby reduce the U.S. ability to compete, but anyone with a retirement plan will likely see their assets worth less. Take Warren Buffett, with a net worth estimated at about $80-plus billion. He would owe $2.4 billion in taxes, say, on April 15. I guess you could "short the market" on April 14 or add a few years to your retirement, but when you add up the investments of all U.S. citizens with $50 million in assets, that's a lot of money coming out of investments every year. You aren't merely taxing the very wealthy, you are affecting the entire U.S. economy. Think unintended consequences.

title: What Came Before the $10 Billion Bet on Flying Taxis
summary: Silicon Valley wants to shuttle people around in helicopter-like electric vehicles. Will they get off the ground? A look back at the early 1900s offers some clues.. Back in Business is an occasional column that puts the present day in perspective by looking at business history and those who shaped it.

title: Factory Fires Point to China Tensions as Violence Escalates in Myanmar
summary: At least 50 die on deadliest day since coup, most in Yangon suburbs where Chinese-owned businesses burned. SINGAPORE-Myanmar authorities declared martial law in parts of Yangon after scores were killed and fires tore through several Chinese-owned garment factories, underscoring the threat to the nation's fragile economy and tensions over China's role in the country.

title: The Pandemic Ignited a Housing Boom-but It's Different From the Last One
summary: Resume Subscription. The residential real-estate market is on its biggest tear since 2006, just before the housing bubble burst and set off a global recession. Yet in nearly every meaningful way, today's market is the inverse of the previous boom.

title: Elon Musk Gets New Title of 'Technoking of Tesla'
summary: The chief executive will retain his role while changing his title at the electric-vehicle maker. Tesla Inc. said Chief Executive Elon Musk has changed his title at the company to "Technoking of Tesla," extending an irreverent streak in the 49-year-old's leadership of the electric-vehicle maker.

title: VW to Build Six Battery Factories in Europe
summary: Move highlights auto industry's massive shift to electric cars. BERLIN- Volkswagen AG said it would invest in six large battery factories and build out charging infrastructure, highlighting some global auto makers' push to take control of battery making as electric vehicles boom.

title: Junk-Loan Rally Cuts Company Borrowing Costs
summary: Recent market moves pushing more investors into leveraged loans, causing prices to rise and helping more companies tap the market. Investors are scooping up low-rated corporate loans, fueling a rally that is lowering borrowing costs for highly indebted companies.

title: Hate Washing Clothes? 'The Laundry Guy' Wants to Change That
summary: Patric Richardson, with a new book and TV series, seeks to transform washing and folding from a chore into a hobby-and shares his secret for cleaning a business suit in a washing machine. Patric Richardson is betting he can make you see laundry not as a chore you tolerate-perhaps hate-but "something you enjoy, look forward to, maybe even love." His book, "Laundry Love, Finding Joy in a Common Chore," and Discovery+ series, "The Laundry Guy," both launching this month, go so far as to argue clothes-washing can be fun.

title: Want to Win Your NCAA Tournament Pool? Don't Pick the Best Team
summary: Be a contrarian. Go with an undervalued team like Houston instead of Gonzaga.. The Gonzaga Bulldogs are undefeated, the overwhelming favorite as the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA tournament and the best men's college basketball team in decades-which is why nearly 40% of brackets already have them winning the national championship.

title: Fixing the Recipe at Danone Will Take Time
summary: Investors successfully ousted the dairy company's unpopular boss but now face a potentially costly overhaul. Activist investors have scored a surprisingly quick win at Danone . Bringing the Paris-listed food company back to full health will be a much lengthier process.

title: In Size and Risk, Biden's Opening Gamble Ranks With Reagan's
summary: With borrowed money and no Republican support in Congress, bet is even bigger than predecessor's, and Democrats will own it for good or bad. Not since Ronald Reagan's presidency has a new administration opened with a gamble as large as the one in which President Biden is now engaged.

title: This Laser Battle Has Sparked a Rebellion
summary: Plunging stock prices have forced Lumentum and II-VI to boost cash portions of bids for Coherent. Lumentum , MKS Instruments and II-VI have at least two things in common. All three companies really, really want to acquire Coherent and all of them have a sizable base of shareholders who don't seem hot on the idea.

title: GAO Calls for Protections to Prevent Retirement Savings From Online Theft
summary: Until the Labor Department takes such steps, participants' assets will remain at risk, report says. Citing data breaches in multiple industries, the U.S. Government Accountability Office on Monday called on the Labor Department to step up protections for investors in retirement plans against the growing threat of cyber theft.

title: Vatican Rules Out Blessings for Same-Sex Relationships
summary: Pope Francis pushes back at some liberal bishops' call for church to embrace gay unions. ROME-The Vatican on Monday forbade blessings of same-sex relationships, contradicting calls for the practice by progressive bishops in Germany and elsewhere, and setting a limit to the conciliatory approach to gay people that has marked Pope Francis' pontificate.

title: Oscar Nominee Andra Day on Billie Holiday and Film-Set Essentials
summary: The R&B singer-turned-actress shares the regimens she follows and gadgets she relies on to stay creative and healthy. "DAUNTING IS definitely an understatement," said Andra Day of making her feature-film debut last month playing jazz legend Billie Holiday in "The United States Vs. Billie Holiday." "I was terrified. I am a huge fan of Billie Holiday," said Ms. Day, who broke onto the R&B and pop music scenes with the monster song "Rise Up" in 2015. "I could not get out of my head that anybody might say, 'Remember that one time Andra Day tried to play Billie?'"

title: Not-So Supertankers Deserve a Look as Pandemic Fades
summary: Profits of oil tanker owners went from their highest to lowest ever in the course of a year as a historic glut reversed, but the industry's fundamentals are set to improve. A year ago, this industry's ship came in. Then it just sat there.

title: Picking a Bracket? Here's What to Know: Don't Listen to Me
summary: The tournament is back after a 2020 suspension, with an Indiana-only location and top seeds from Gonzaga, Baylor, Illinois and Some Other School That Had a Good Season. It is another hopeful sign that the planet is winding its way toward recovery: For the first time in two years, you have the opportunity to fill yourself with self-loathing and regret by filling out a March Madness bracket.

title: 'Mank' Leads With 10 Oscar Nods; Netflix Comes Out Ahead
summary: The Academy Award nominations mark the home stretch of an award season delayed by the pandemic, after a year when most movies were exiled from theaters. With 10 nominations, "Mank," a black-and-white immersion into old Hollywood and the writing of "Citizen Kane," leads the nominees for the 93rd Academy Awards announced Monday, setting up an odd Oscars celebration following a year when movies were largely exiled from theaters.

title: China Targets Hong Kong Wealth Gap, Housing Woes
summary: Senior officials discuss changes to city's tax structure and increasing housing supply. After quashing opposition groups in Hong Kong, China's leaders plan to target the city's yawning wealth gap and lack of affordable housing that Beijing blames for fueling social unrest.

title: Caesars Entertainment, GenMark, Eli Lilly: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: U.S. stock futures wavered and crude prices ticked lower. Here's what we're watching ahead of Monday's opening bell.

title: U.S. Deploys Coast Guard Far From Home to Counter China
summary: The service has gotten increasingly active in the Western Pacific as Chinese fishing fleets expand into new waters. Early last December, the crew of the U.S. Coast Guard cutter Myrtle Hazard sailed through the night, anchored off the Pacific island nation of Palau and boarded a group of Chinese boats to help seize tens of thousands of dollars worth of sea cucumber that had allegedly been harvested illegally.

title: Manhattan District Attorney Candidates Throw Out Playbook
summary: Most candidates address city's rising violence with specialized courts, education and alternative approaches to jail. When a 24-hour spree of subway-system attacks left two homeless New Yorkers dead and two others wounded in February, the eight Democratic candidates running for Manhattan district attorney didn't follow the traditional playbook with calls for more policing and harsher sentencing.

title: When CEOs Really Think We'll Come Back to Work
summary: Executives split over office return dates, business travel and remote work's long-term viability. Top executives are seeing light at the end of the pandemic tunnel as the U.S. vaccination efforts continue to ramp up and more states expand eligibility for shots. But corporate leaders are still split on what the workplace will look like in 2021 and beyond.

title: I See Right Through You (Saturday Crossword, March 13)
Jane Goodall's Advice on How to Lead a Full Life
summary: The world-renowned scientist and conservationist has spent the pandemic living at her childhood home in England, watching "mindless television" with her sister at suppertime and working around the clock. In our series My Monday Morning, self-motivated people tell WSJ. how they start off the week.

title: Chinese Monetary Policy Looks Looser Than Advertised
summary: While headline economic numbers are impressive yet not very meaningful, there are clues to what Beijing is doing behind the scenes. China's industrial output and retail sales jumped by their most in more than a decade in the first two months of 2021: up 35% and 34% year-over-year respectively. Those are big numbers-but sadly, not very meaningful ones.

title: Are Frequent-Flier Programs Really Worth More Than Airlines?
summary: Disclosures by U.S. airlines suggest high valuations for loyalty businesses, but they can't be analyzed as fully separate from core transport operations. Wall Street sees airlines as less than the sum of their parts: Carriers' valuations are below those of their own frequent-flier programs, data disclosed during the pandemic suggest. But this isn't necessarily a clear buy signal for investors.

title: Blackstone's Hedge-Fund Business to Launch Growth Strategy
summary: Firm taps former hedge-fund manager Scott Bommer to roll out the 'Horizon' platform. The world's biggest investor in hedge funds has hired former hedge-fund manager Scott Bommer to launch a new growth strategy, a move aimed at expanding Blackstone Group Inc.'s hedge-fund business with offerings intended to generate big returns for clients.

title: CEO of Yogurt Giant Danone Steps Aside After Clash With Activists
summary: Investors had called for Emmanuel Faber's ouster, citing Danone's lackluster share price and underperforming brands. PARIS- Danone SA's Chief Executive and Chairman Emmanuel Faber has stepped down from the yogurt maker after a clash with investors, marking a rare victory for activist funds in France's rigid corporate landscape.

title: Tencent's Trillion-Dollar Valuation May Have to Wait
summary: A two-day plunge in Tencent's shares has already wiped out $65 billion from the company's market value. Just a few weeks ago, Chinese videogame and internet technology giant Tencent looked near to cracking a $1 trillion valuation. Shifting winds out of Beijing could blow that out of reach for quite a while.

title: Gilead and Merck Join Forces to Develop Long-Acting HIV Treatment
summary: Rival drugmakers agreed to collaborate on an HIV drug cocktail that could be taken every several months rather than once a day. Rivals Gilead Sciences Inc. and Merck & Co. are joining forces to develop a long-acting HIV therapy, the next frontier in treating the disease.

title: Republicans Push Biden to Take Aggressive Stance Toward China
summary: The president, who has called China 'our most serious competitor,' is trying to enlist allies to counter Beijing. WASHINGTON-As President Biden devotes himself to dealing with the coronavirus pandemic, Republicans are striving to elevate China policy as a top issue, pressuring him to take an aggressive stance as Americans' opinion toward the global rival grows more negative.

title: Minority-Owned Investment Banks Are Underwriting More Corporate Bond Offerings
summary: Participation in debt offerings by firms with diverse ownership was at an all-time high last year, according to Refinitiv. Finance chiefs are hiring minority-owned investment banks as underwriters on their corporate bond offerings more frequently, aiming to attract new investors and demonstrate their commitment to diversity.

title: With Its Whistleblowing Directive, EU Charts a Different Course From U.S.
summary: European authorities are seeking to set up a minimum standard for whistleblower rules across EU member states, but they don't favor paying for tips-a key part of an SEC program widely seen as a success. A difference between U.S. whistleblower laws and the regime taking shape in Europe shines a light on a key question for policy makers: What motivates people to come forward with information about wrongdoing?

title: Wave of Legal Appeals Challenges How European Regulators Enforce Privacy Rules
summary: Companies are filing more appeals of privacy fines, and winning in court. Nearly three years after a sweeping privacy law took effect in Europe, regulators are seeing more sanction decisions challenged and overturned as companies file appeals.

title: Colleges Begin Mapping Out a More Normal Fall-With Caveats
summary: Michigan State, University of South Florida and others anticipate more in-person classes but warn of potential curveballs. Colleges and universities around the country are beginning to detail their plans for next fall, anticipating more students on campus, a full slate of in-person classes and even concerts and cheering sports fans.

title: Retail Bankruptcy Filings Have Seen Marked Slowdown Since Fall
summary: Only two major retailers have filed for bankruptcy this year, according to a BDO report. The pace of bankruptcy filings by major retailers has slowed markedly since the fall, according to a report by professional services firm BDO USA LLP.

title: Electric-Vehicle Startups Promise Record-Setting Revenue Growth
summary: Companies with little revenue today project explosive growth in short time; some investors are skeptical. It took Google eight years to reach $10 billion in sales, the fastest ever for a U.S. startup. In the current SPAC frenzy, a spate of electric-vehicle companies planning listings are vowing to beat its record-in some cases by several years.

title: China's Economic Activity Soars
summary: Retail sales lose momentum from the final months of 2020 as fresh Covid-19 restrictions weigh on consumption. BEIJING-Chinese economic activity surged in the first two months of 2021 when compared with the same coronavirus-battered period last year, though the picture was less rosy when weighed against growth momentum in the final months of 2020.

title: Embattled Cuomo Says He Won't Step Down
summary: Allies of New York's Democratic governor, meanwhile, are making calls to shore up support. ALBANY, N.Y.-New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo dug in this weekend against growing demands from fellow Democrats that he step aside as he faces accusations of inappropriate conduct toward multiple women and criticism over the state's handling of Covid-19 in nursing homes.

title: Myanmar Coup: What's Happening and Why Are There Protests?
summary: Resume Subscription. Massive protests have swept Myanmar in opposition to a Feb. 1 coup that ended the country's decadelong shift toward democracy and returned it to military rule. The takeover has pit citizens, who have poured into the streets in the hundreds of thousands, against a powerful military that has used lethal force to crush democracy movements in the past.

title: Taylor Swift, Beyoncé Break Records at Intimate Grammys
summary: Other top awards go to Billie Eilish for record of the year, Megan Thee Stallion for best new artist and H.E.R. for song of the year. The 63rd annual Grammy Awards struck an intimate tone in a difficult year on Sunday, with natural-feeling, leisurely-paced live and pre-taped performances joining moving tributes in an evening that departed from the glossy, celebrity-fueled shows of yore and showcased women artists, who swept the major awards.

title: Chinese Factories Burn in Myanmar's Deadliest Weekend of Protests Since Coup
summary: Dozens killed as security forces open fire on demonstrators in several cities. Dozens were killed and several Chinese factories set ablaze in Myanmar on Sunday during the deadliest weekend since the country's military seized power in a coup last month.

title: Biden Expected to Tap Sperling to Implement Relief Plan
summary: The veteran of Democratic administrations led the White House National Economic Council under Clinton and Obama. WASHINGTON-President Biden is expected to tap Gene Sperling, a veteran of Democratic administrations, to lead the implementation of the $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief law, an administration official said Sunday.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Covert Plots (Monday Crossword, March 15)
